Title: Restless
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Very restless. Often running about or jumping up and down. Hardly ever still
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): Restless, overactive, cannot stay still for long

Title: Fights/bullies
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Frequently fights other children + Bullies other children
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): Often fights with other children or bullies them

Title: Distracted
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Cannot settle to anything for more than a few moments

Title: Tantrums
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): Often has temper tantrums or hot tempers

Title: Disobedient
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): (+) Generally obedient, usually does what adults request

Title: Worried
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Often worried, worries about many things

Title: Fearful
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Tends to be fearful or afraid of new things or new situations
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): Nervous or clingy in new situations, easily loses confidence

Title: Solitary
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Tends to do things on his/her own, rather solitary
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): Rather solitary, tends to play alone

Title: Unhappy
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Often appears miserable, unhappy, tearful or distressed

Title: Aches
Rutter wording (BCS 1970): Complains of headaches + Complains of stomach-ache or has vomited
SDQ wording (MCS 2000/1): Often complains of head- aches, stomach-ache or sickness
